name: Okta Application deleted
description: An application has been delete on Okta SSO.

name: Lacework Cloud Security Low Severity Alert
description: Detects when a low alert severity is raised by Lacework. This severity level might indicates a change in configuration that could be malicious or not.

name: Google Workspace User Creation
description: Detects when a new user is created.

name: Bitsight SPM Minor Vulnerability
description: Bitsight SPM has raised a minor vulnerability finding

name: AWS CloudTrail Remove Flow logs
description: Detects when an attacker is removing Flow Logs to cover their tracks
attack: defense-evasion - Disable or Modify Cloud Logs (T1562.008)

name: Cloudflare WAF Correlation Alerts
description: Detection of multiple alerts (more than 5) triggered by the same source by Cloudflare detection rules

name: Okta Network Zone Modified
description: Detects attempts to modify an Okta network zone. Okta network zones can be configured to limit or restrict access to a network based on IP addresses or geolocations. An adversary may attempt to modify, delete, or deactivate an Okta network zone in order to remove or weaken an organization's security controls.
attack: defense-evasion - Disable or Modify Cloud Firewall (T1562.007)

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Unfamiliar Features
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) identifies sign-ins with characteristics that deviate from past sign-in properties. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: AWS CloudTrail RDS Public DB Restore
description: Detects the recovery of a new public database instance from a snapshot. It may be a part of data exfiltration.

name: Microsoft 365 Email Forwarding To Consumer Email Address
description: An email forwarding rule was created, that automatically forwards incoming emails to an address outside of the organization (most common consumer email services).

name: Okta User Account Deactivated
description: A user account has been deactivated in Okta.

name: AWS CloudTrail GuardDuty Detector Deleted
description: Detects when an attacker is trying to evade defenses by deleting a GuardDuty detector

name: Okta Network Zone Deleted
description: Detects attempts to delete an Okta network zone. Okta network zones can be configured to limit or restrict access to a network based on IP addresses or geolocations. An adversary may attempt to modify, delete, or deactivate an Okta network zone in order to remove or weaken an organization's security controls.
attack: defense-evasion - Disable or Modify Cloud Firewall (T1562.007)

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Impossible Travel
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) identifies two user activities (a single or multiple sessions) originating from geographically distant locations within a time period shorter than the time it would have taken the user to travel from the first location to the second. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: Entra ID Sign-In Via Known AiTM Phishing Kit (Rockstar 2FA)
description: Detects a sign-in attempt with known characteristics of the adversary-in-the-middle phishing kit Rockstar 2FA.

name: Login Brute-Force Successful On Okta
description: A user has attempted to login several times (brute-force) on Okta and succeeded to login.

name: Google Cloud Audit Logs Custom Gmail Route
description: Detects when a custom Gmail route is added or modified. This could be abused by attackers to exfiltrate data.

name: WAF Block Rule
description: Detects when one of WAF rule blocked an HTTP request

name: Okta Admin Privilege Granted
description: Administrator privilege granted to an user or account. This can be privilege escalation, persistance over system or account takedown.

name: Okta Unauthorized Access to App
description: An user tries to access an unauthorized application.

name: AWS CloudTrail EC2 Security Group Modified
description: Detects when an AWS EC2 security group has been modified

name: Google Cloud Audit Logs Application Authorized
description: Detects when an application is authorized to access a Google user account. An exception is currently made for GMAIL because of the large number of hits.

name: AWS CloudTrail EC2 Startup Script Changed
description: Detects changes to the EC2 instance startup script. The shell script will be executed as root/SYSTEM everytime the specific instances are booted up.

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Anonymous IP
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) identifies sign-ins from a risky IP address, for example, using an anonymous browser or VPN. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: AWS CloudTrail Route 53 Domain Transfer Attempt
description: Detects when a request in success or failure is made to transfer a domain name to an other AWS account

name: Okta API Token revoked
description: A new API Token has been deleted on Okta SSO.

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Successful Password Spraying From Single IP Address
description: An IP address performed several failed logins on multiple users to then have a successful login on one of them. Note that even if the sign-in was blocked by MFA (error 50074/50076/50158) or conditional access (error 50097/53003), these verifications only occur after the correct password was submitted. The account's password must still be considered compromised, and be changed.

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Suspicious Inbox Forwarding
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) identifies suspicious email forwarding rules, for example, if a user created an inbox rule that forwards a copy of all emails to an external address. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: Google Workspace External Sharing
description: Detects a large number of external sharing.

name: Okta MFA Disabled
description: A MFA has beed disabled in Okta SSO. This is a common behavior to gain permanent access over a system.

name: AWS CloudTrail EC2 Instance Connect SendSSHPublicKey
description: Detects when an attacker is pushing an SSH Public Key to an EC2 instance. Then he can establish a connection to the console using SSH.

name: GitHub New Organization Member
description: Detects when a member is added or invited to a GitHub organization.

name: AWS CloudTrail S3 Bucket Replication
description: Detects a replication rule being enable for a given S3 bucket: it could provide an attacker a way to exfiltrate data.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) MailBoxAuditBypassAssociation Option Implementation
description: Detects the implementation of a MailBoxAuditBypassAssociation option in Microsoft 365 (Office 365). This option is used when you configure a user or computer account to bypass mailbox audit logging, access or actions taken by the user or computer account to any mailbox isn't logged.

name: Jumpcloud Account Locked
description: A user has been locked on Jumpcloud portal.

name: AWS CloudTrail Route 53 Domain Transfer Lock Disabled
description: Detects when the transfer lock feature is disabled on a domain name handled by AWS Route 53 service.

name: AWS Persistence By Creating KeyPair And SecurityGroup
description: Attackers can use AWS credentials to create a KeyPair and a SecurityGroup to have continuous access to the AWS account.

name: Google Workspace Bypass 2FA
description: Detects when user tries to bypass the 2FA.

name: Microsoft 365 Suspicious Inbox Rule
description: Business Email Compromise threat actors often create inbox rules to forward, hide, or delete emails containing sensitive information. This rule detects common caracteristics of malicious inbox rules.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) DLP Policy Removed
description: Detects when a DLP (Data Loss Prevention) policy is removed in Microsoft 365 (Office 365). DLP policies defines which resources can be shared and with whom, preventing sensitive information from being leaked.

name: Okta User Account Locked
description: An user has been locked in Okta.

name: AWS GuardDuty Low Severity Alert
description: GuardDuty has detected a threat with a low severity level. A low severity level indicates attempted suspicious activity that did not compromise your network, for example, a port scan or a failed intrusion attempt.

name: Zscaler ZIA Suspicious Threat Outbreak
description: Spots a peak of malicious threat detection by Zscaler ZIA

name: Login Brute-Force Successful On Jumpcloud Workstation
description: A user has attempted to login several times (brute-force) on Jumpcloud monitored workstations (windows, linux, mac) and succeeded to login.

name: Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Low Severity Alert
description: Detects when a low alert severity is raised by Trend Micro Vision One Workbench.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]

name: Password Reset Error Brute-Force On AzureAD
description: A reset of password has failed on Azure Active Directory, 5 times within the same entity.

name: GitHub Outside Collaborator Detected
description: Detects an outside collaborator being removed or having its permissions changed.

name: AWS CloudTrail KMS CMK Key Deleted
description: Detects when a CMK is deleted or scheduled for deletion

name: Trend Micro Cloud One Low Intrusion
description: Detects when Trend Micro EDR raised an alert for an intrusion with a low severity level.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 Low Severity AIR Alert Requires Action
description: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 includes the capability to run Automated investigation and response (AIR) actions. This rule detects when a Low or Informational severity alert triggered an automated investigation, and remediation actions need to be approved or conducted. Low and Informational alerts include when an email is reported by a user, or when a malicious email is removed after delivery.

name: Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Medium Severity Alert
description: Detects when a medium alert severity is raised by Trend Micro Vision One Workbench.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]

name: Okta Suspicious Activity Reported
description: Detects when a user reports suspicious activity for their Okta account. These events should be investigated, as they can help security teams identify when an adversary is attempting to gain access to their network.

name: AWS CloudTrail GuardDuty Disruption
description: Detects updates of the GuardDuty list of trusted IPs, perhaps to disable security alerts against malicious IPs

name: GitHub Dependabot Or Vulnerability Alerts Disabled
description: Detects dependabot or vulnerability alerts being disabled. Dependabot performs a scan to detect insecure dependencies, and sends Dependabot alerts.

name: Google Workspace Password Change
description: Detects when a password is changed. An attacker can perform this action to impact the availability of the account.

name: Google Workspace Admin Creation
description: Detects when an admin is created or when his role is changed.

name: Okta Network Zone Deactivated
description: Detects attempts to deactivate an Okta network zone. Okta network zones can be configured to limit or restrict access to a network based on IP addresses or geolocations. An adversary may attempt to modify, delete, or deactivate an Okta network zone in order to remove or weaken an organization's security controls.
attack: defense-evasion - Disable or Modify Cloud Firewall (T1562.007)

name: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 Medium Severity AIR Alert
description: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 includes the capability to run Automated investigation and response (AIR) actions. This rule detects when a Medium severity alert triggers an automated investigation, such as when suspicious email sending patterns are detected from an account.

name: Jumpcloud Policy Modified
description: Detects when a Jumpcloud policy is modified.
attack: privilege-escalation - Domain or Tenant Policy Modification (T1484)

name: AWS CloudTrail Root ConsoleLogin
description: Detects a login with a root account on AWS portal. It is a best practice to avoid root account usage for daily tasks and to create an IAM admin user.

name: Google Workspace MFA changed
description: Detects when the settings for the MFA are modified.

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Self Service Password Reset In Failure
description: Detects self-service password reset in failure for various reasons (except licence or policy ones)

name: Entra ID Sign-In Via Known AiTM Phishing Kit (Sneaky 2FA)
description: Detects a sign-in attempt with an impossible device shift characteristic of the adversary-in-the-middle phishing kit Sneaky 2FA.

name: Microsoft 365 Email Forwarding To Email Address With Rare TLD
description: An email forwarding rule was created, that automatically forwards incoming emails to an address outside of the organization (less common top-level domain).

name: Okta User Logged In From Multiple Countries
description: Detection of login events from multiple countries.

name: Veeam Backup & Replication Malware Detection
description: Veeam Backup & Replication has detected some malware related activity

name: Lacework Cloud Security Critical Severity Alert
description: Detects when a critical alert severity is raised by Lacework. This severity level might indicates a suspicious change in configuration or policy violation.

name: Okta API Token created
description: A new API Token has been created on Okta SSO.

name: Suspicious Activity Using Quick Assist
description: Detects when a chat is created (abusing Quick Assist feature) with a user external to the domain, which has been observed as a some phishing attemp by ransomware groups.

name: AWS CloudTrail EC2 CreateVPC
description: Detects when a VPC is created.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) Safelinks Disabled
description: Detects when a safelink rule has been deleted in Microsoft 365 (Office 365). Safe Links is a feature in Defender for Microsoft 365 (Office 365) that provides URL scanning and rewriting of inbound email messages in mail flow, and time-of-click verification of URLs and links in email messages and other locations.

name: Entra ID Sign-In Via Known AiTM Phishing Kit (Mamba 2FA)
description: Detects a sign-in attempt with known characteristics of the adversary-in-the-middle phishing kit tracked by Sekoia.io as Mamba 2FA.

name: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 Low Severity AIR Alert Handled Automatically
description: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 includes the capability to run Automated investigation and response (AIR) actions. This rule detects when a Low or Informational severity alert triggered an automated investigation, and remediation was conducted automatically. Low and Informational alerts include when an email is reported by a user, or when a malicious email is removed after delivery.

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Suspicious IP
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) identifies a suspicious IP address. An IP address is considered suspicious based on high failure rates because of invalid credentials received from the IP address or other IP reputation sources. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: AWS CloudTrail RDS DB Cluster/Instance Deleted
description: Detects when an attacker is destroying a RDS Cluster or Instance

name: Microsoft 365 Device Code Authentication
description: Authentication via a device code is designed for use with input constrained devices. This method can however be abused, particularly in social engineering attacks. Whitelisting based on the organisation's practices is likely required to make this rule useful (e.g. excluding the public IP ranges of the organisation, excluding authentications attempt from managed devices, etc.). Note: if you collect Entra ID SignInLogs, the rule "Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Device Code Authentication" is a better equivalent to this rule.

name: AWS CloudTrail ECS Cluster Deleted
description: Detects when an attacker is destroying an AWS ECS Cluster

name: Google Workspace Admin Modification
description: Detects when an admin is modified.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) Malware Filter Policy Removed
description: Detects when a malware policy has been deleted in Microsoft 365 (Office 365). A malware filter policy is used to alert administrators that an internal user sent a message that contained malware.

name: Lacework Cloud Security Medium Severity Alert
description: Detects when a medium alert severity is raised by Lacework. This severity level might indicates a suspicious activity such as new source from user connection.

name: Okta Security Threat Configuration Updated
description: Detects when the threat configuration has been updated in Okta.

name: Microsoft 365 Security and Compliance Center High Severity Alert
description: A security or compliance-related alert of high severity was raised, based on the policies of the tenant. This rule can be very noisy depending on the configuration of the tenant. Alert filters are likely required. In addition, most alerts don't include any context, and are only useful if the analysts have access to the Microsoft portals to investigate.

name: AWS CloudTrail GuardDuty Detector Suspended
description: Detects the suspension of the GuardDuty service

name: Google Workspace Login Brute-Force
description: Detects when a user failed to login multiple times before a successful login.

name: Login Brute-Force On Sekoia.io
description: Detects successful access to Sekoia.io after several failure.

name: Microsoft Intune Policy Change
description: Detects edits, deletions or creations made to an organization Microsoft Intune policies.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) Potential Ransomware Activity Detected
description: Detects when Microsoft Cloud App Security reports that a user has uploaded files to the cloud that might be infected with ransomware.

name: Google Cloud Audit Logs Trusted Domain Added
description: Detects when a domain name is added to Google Workspace Trusted Domain. This could be used by an attacker to bypass some security controls or just be a legit admin action.
attack: defense-evasion - Disable or Modify Cloud Firewall (T1562.007)

name: Okta MFA Bypass Attempt
description: A bypass of MFA may have been attempted.

name: Google Workspace Account Warning
description: Detects a suspicious login, leaked password, or account disabled following suspicious activity.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) MCAS Detection Velocity
description: Detects when Microsoft Cloud App Security identifies two user activities (a single or multiple sessions) originating from geographically distant locations within a time period shorter than the time it would have taken the user to travel from the first location to the second. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft 365 (Office 365) E5 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-cloud-apps/get-started?culture=fr-fr&country=FR).

name: Google Cloud Audit Logs Email Forwarding
description: Detects when an out of domain email forwarding is enabled on Google Cloud.

name: AWS CloudTrail IAM UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint
description: Detects the update of a ThumbPrint from an identity provider that supports OpenID Connect. This could be a sign of an attacker adding a trusted certificate.

name: Okta Blacklist Manipulations
description: Detects when some manipulation are done in blacklist configurations.

name: Microsoft 365 Security and Compliance Center Medium Severity Alert
description: A security or compliance-related alert of medium severity was raised, based on the policies of the tenant. This rule can be very noisy depending on the configuration of the tenant. Alert filters are likely required. In addition, most alerts don't include any context, and are only useful if the analysts have access to the Microsoft portals to investigate.

name: Password Change Brute-Force On AzureAD
description: A change of password has failed on Azure Active Directory, 5 times for the same user

name: Google Workspace User Suspended
description: Detects when an user is suspended. An attacker can use this to remove an account used during the intrusion.

name: RSA SecurID Failed Authentification
description: Detects many failed attempts to authenticate followed by a successfull login for a super admin account.

name: AWS CloudTrail Disable MFA
description: Detects a user disabling the multi factor authentication mechanism for its account. It could be a sign of malicious activity.

name: AWS CloudTrail EC2 DeleteKeyPair
description: Detects when a specific key pair is deleted. This means the public key was removed from EC2.

name: Google Workspace App Script Scheduled Task
description: Detects when a scheduled task is launched by Google App Script. This product is used to create scripts and integrate applications within Google Workspace.

name: Entra ID Consent Attempt to Suspicious OAuth Application
description: Detects an attempt to authorize account access to an OAuth application commonly used in business email compromise (BEC) attacks. Investigate the source IP address: unusual countries, RDP hosts and VPN providers are likely indicators of malicious activity.

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Token Issuer Anomaly
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) indicates that The SAML token issuer for the associated SAML token is potentially compromised. The claims included in the token are unusual or match known attacker patterns. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: AWS CloudTrail IAM CreateOpenIDConnectProvider
description: Detects the creation of an IAM entity to describe an identity provider that supports OpenID Connect.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) Malware Uploaded On SharePoint
description: Detects when Microsoft 365 (Office 365) identifies a malicious file uploaded to SharePoint. Attackers can use this method to propagate through the network.

name: Cisco ESA Suspicious Email With Attachment
description: Detects an email with an attachment, from a sender tagged as suspect, detected by either the Antivirus or the Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) engine and delivered to the recipient

name: Okta Security Threat Detected
description: Detects when a security threat is detected in Okta.

name: AWS CloudTrail IAM AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider
description: Detects the addition of a Client ID to an existing identity provider that supports OpenID Connect.

name: Google Workspace User Deletion
description: Detects when an user is deleted.

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Leaked Credentials
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) identifies that the user's valid credentials have been leaked. This sharing is typically done by posting publicly on the dark web, paste sites, or by trading and selling the credentials on the black market. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: Microsoft 365 Authenticated Activity From Tor IP Address
description: Detects authenticated Microsoft 365 activity from an IP address associated with Tor.

name: Sekoia.io EICAR Detection
description: Detects observables in Sekoia.io CTI tagged as EICAR, which are fake samples meant to test detection.
intake-formats: Skyhigh Secure Web Gateway / McAfee Web Gateway
Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
WatchGuard Endpoint Security / Panda Security Aether
Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security
GraphAPI for Microsoft Entra ID / Azure AD [BETA]

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Domain Trust Modification
description: Adversaries may add new domain trusts or modify the properties of existing domain trusts to evade defenses and/or elevate privileges. Confirm the added or modified target domain/URL is legitimate administrator behavior.

name: Bitsight SPM Material Vulnerability
description: Bitsight SPM has raised a material vulnerability finding

name: Microsoft 365 Email Forwarding To Privacy Email Address
description: An email forwarding rule was created, that automatically forwards incoming emails to an address outside of the organization (most common privacy email services).

name: Zscaler ZIA Malicious Threat Outbreak
description: Spots a peak of malicious threat detection by Zscaler ZIA

name: Tenable Identity Exposure / Alsid High Severity Alert
description: Tenable Identity Exposure / Alsid raised an alert.
attack: privilege-escalation - Domain or Tenant Policy Modification (T1484)

name: Mimecast Email Security Virus Not Denied
description: Detects when a virus signature has been detected by Mimecast and was not denied.

name: AWS GuardDuty Medium Severity Alert
description: GuardDuty has detected a threat with a medium severity level. A Medium severity level indicates suspicious activity that deviates from normally observed behavior and, depending on your use case, may be indicative of a resource compromise.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) MCAS Inbox Hiding
description: Detects when Microsoft Cloud App Security identifies that a suspicious inbox rule was set on a user’s inbox. This may indicate that the user account is compromised, and that the mailbox is being used to distribute spam and malware in your organization. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft 365 (Office 365) E5 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-cloud-apps/get-started?culture=fr-fr&country=FR).

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) Safe Attachment Rule Disabled
description: Detects when the safe attachment rule has been deleted in Microsoft 365 (Office 365). Safe Attachments is a feature in Microsoft Defender for Microsoft 365 (Office 365) that opens email attachments in a special hypervisor environment to detect malicious activity.

name: Fastly Next-Gen WAF Audit Threat Alert
description: Forward a threat detection made by Fastly Next-Gen WAF Audit Logs

name: Google Cloud Audit Logs Drive Ownership Transferred
description: Detects when Drive/Docs user files ownership is transferred. The legit use case is when a user is being removed, but this could also be abused by an attacker for exfiltration.
attack: exfiltration - Transfer Data to Cloud Account (T1537)

name: Microsoft Defender XDR Endpoint Alert
description: Microsoft Defender XDR has raised an alert for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. The alert info and evidence events are grouped with the similarity into the same Sekoia.io alert.

name: Zscaler ZIA Malicious Threat
description: Zscaler Internet Access has detected a network traffic as malicious

name: Okta User Account Created
description: A user account has been created in Okta.

name: Lacework Cloud Security High Severity Alert
description: Detects when a high alert severity is raised by Lacework. This severity level might indicates a suspicious change in configuration or policy violation.

name: Google Workspace Blocked Sender
description: Detects when a user is blocked by google workspace.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) MCAS Risky IP
description: Detects when Microsoft Cloud App Security identifies sign-ins from a risky IP address, for example, using an anonymous browser or VPN. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft 365 (Office 365) E5 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-cloud-apps/get-started?culture=fr-fr&country=FR).

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Threat Intelligence
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) identifies a sign-in activity that is unusual for the given user or is consistent with known attack patterns based on Microsoft's internal and external threat intelligence sources. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: Microsoft Defender XDR Alert
description: Microsoft Defender XDR has raised an alert. The alert info and evidence events are grouped with the similarity into the same Sekoia.io alert.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) AtpDetection
description: Detects when an AtpDetection (Advanced Threat Protection) event from the Office365 ThreatIntelligence service is raised. AtpDetection is a service which secures emails, attachments, and files by scanning them for threats.

name: Okta Policy Modified or Deleted
description: Detects when an Okta policy is modified or deleted.
attack: privilege-escalation - Domain or Tenant Policy Modification (T1484)

name: Mimecast Email Security Spam Not Denied
description: Detects when a spam has been detected by Mimecast and was not denied.

name: Varonis Many File Created and Deleted
description: This rule identifies a high number of file created and deleted on the same host. It is a typical ransomware behavior.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) MCAS New Country
description: Detects when Microsoft Cloud App Security identifies a sign-in from a country where it has never connected. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft 365 (Office 365) E5 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-cloud-apps/get-started?culture=fr-fr&country=FR).

name: Google Workspace Suspicious Login
description: Detects a suspicious login reported by google.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) MCAS Repeated Failed Login
description: Detects when Microsoft Cloud App Security identifies a large number of failed login attempts which may indicate a brute-force attempt. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft 365 (Office 365) E5 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-cloud-apps/get-started?culture=fr-fr&country=FR).

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Malicious IP
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) identifies a malicious IP address. An IP address is considered malicious based on high failure rates because of invalid credentials received from the IP address or other IP reputation sources. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: Trend Micro Cloud One High Intrusion
description: Detects when Trend Micro EDR raised an alert for an intrusion with a high severity level.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: AWS CloudTrail EC2 Enable Serial Console Access
description: Detects when the EC2 serial console access feature is enabled. This could abused by some attackers to avoid network detection when accessing to EC2 instances.

name: Entra ID Sign-In Via Known AiTM Phishing Kit (Tycoon 2FA)
description: Detects a sign-in attempt with known characteristics of the adversary-in-the-middle phishing kit Tycoon 2FA.

name: Bitsight SPM Moderate Vulnerability
description: Bitsight SPM has raised a moderate vulnerability finding

name: Multiple Authentication On Microsoft 365 (Office 365) Portal From Two IP Addresses
description: Detection of login events from two IP addresses within 3mn, as it could happen if someone got phished with a tool like Evilginx2.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) Anti-Phishing Rule Deletion
description: Detects the deactivation of the anti-phishing rule from Microsoft 365 (Office 365). The anti-phishing rule specifies the priority and recipient filters (who the policy applies to) for an anti-phish policy.

name: AWS CloudTrail EC2 CreateKeyPair
description: Detects when a key pair is created. Usually, SendSSHPublicKey is used afterwards to push the created key to an EC2 instance in order to be able to establish a connection to that instance.

name: WAF Correlation Block actions
description: Detection of multiple block actions (more than 30) triggered by the same source by WAF detection rules

name: Google Cloud Audit Logs Attack Warning
description: Detects when Google Cloud Audit Logs notify an attack warning such as the famous "Government-backed attack".

name: AWS CloudTrail IAM Password Policy Updated
description: Detects an update to the password policy. This could be an attempt to lower accounts security level.

name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Abnormal Token
description: Detects when Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) indicates that there are abnormal characteristics in the token such as an unusual token lifetime or a token that is played from an unfamiliar location. To use this feature, you must have an Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) Premium P2 license (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/identity-protection/overview-identity-protection).

name: Okta Suspicious Use of a Session Cookie
description: Suspicious use of a session cookie by detecting multiple client values (IP, User Agent, etc.) changing for the same Device Token associated with a specific user.

name: WIZ Issues Critical Alert Raised
description: Detects when a critical alert from WIZ Issues is raised.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) Malware Filter Rule Deletion
description: Detects when a malware filter rule has been deleted in Microsoft 365 (Office 365). The malware filter rule specifies the priority and recipient filters (who the policy applies to) for a malware filter policy.

name: Google Cloud Audit Logs Account Suspended
description: Detects when Google Cloud Audit Logs notify a user account suspended for a suspicious activity

name: Google Workspace Anomaly File Downloads
description: Detects a large number of file downloads.

name: Okta MFA Brute-Force Successful
description: A user has attempted to login several times (brute-force) on Okta and succeeded to login by spamming MFA.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office 365) Anti-Phishing Policy Deletion

It is a remote code execution which can be exploited without authentication via HTTP. An HTTP response status code = 202, means the target is vulnerable, the analyst then has to look in depth to check if a webshell has been uploaded or something else has been done.

name: TOR Usage
description: Detects TOR usage, based on the IP address and the destination port (filtered on NTP). TOR is short for The Onion Router, and it gets its name from how it works. TOR intercepts the network traffic from one or more apps on user’s computer, usually the user web browser, and shuffles it through a number of randomly-chosen computers before passing it on to its destination. This disguises user location, and makes it harder for servers to pick him/her out on repeat visits, or to tie together separate visits to different sites, this making tracking and surveillance more difficult. Before a network packet starts its journey, user’s computer chooses a random list of relays and repeatedly encrypts the data in multiple layers, like an onion. Each relay knows only enough to strip off the outermost layer of encryption, before passing what’s left on to the next relay in the list.

description: The vSphere Client (HTML5) contains a remote code execution vulnerability in a vCenter Server plugin. A malicious actor with network access to port 443 may exploit this issue to execute commands with unrestricted privileges on the underlying operating system that hosts vCenter Server. This affects VMware vCenter Server (7.x before 7.0 U1c, 6.7 before 6.7 U3l and 6.5 before 6.5 U3n) and VMware Cloud Foundation (4.x before 4.2 and 3.x before 3.10.1.2). POST request on the following PATH "/ui/vropspluginui/rest/services/uploadova". If in response body (500) the words it has "uploadFile", that means the vCenter is available to accept files via POST without any restrictions.

name: CVE-2019-11510 Pulse Secure Exploit
description: Detects the successful exploitation of the Pulse Secure vulnerability CVE-2019-11510. This CVE is one of the most exploited CVEs since 2019. It is exploited by diverse threat actors, leading sometimes in ransomware deployement among these groups: Maze, Conti, Egregor, DoppelPaymer, NetWalker and REvil. But also APT actors such as APT29. The exploitation of this CVE allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to compromise a vulnerable VPN server. The attacker may be able to gain access to all active users and their plain-text credentials. It may also be possible for the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on each VPN client as it successfully connects to the VPN server. The exploit reads /etc/passwd file to get access to login and passwords in (clear/text). An HTTP response status code = 200, means the file was successfully accessed. This vulnerability affects 8.1R15.1, 8.2 before 8.2R12.1, 8.3 before 8.3R7.1, and 9.0 before 9.0R3.4 products.
intake-formats: Skyhigh Secure Web Gateway / McAfee Web Gateway

name: TOR Usage Generic Rule
description: Detects TOR usage globally, whether the IP is a destination or source. TOR is short for The Onion Router, and it gets its name from how it works. TOR intercepts the network traffic from one or more apps on user’s computer, usually the user web browser, and shuffles it through a number of randomly-chosen computers before passing it on to its destination. This disguises user location, and makes it harder for servers to pick him/her out on repeat visits, or to tie together separate visits to different sites, this making tracking and surveillance more difficult. Before a network packet starts its journey, user’s computer chooses a random list of relays and repeatedly encrypts the data in multiple layers, like an onion. Each relay knows only enough to strip off the outermost layer of encryption, before passing what’s left on to the next relay in the list.
intake-formats: Skyhigh Secure Web Gateway / McAfee Web Gateway

name: CVE-2018-13379 Fortinet Exploit
description: Detects the successful exploitation of the Fortinet FortiOS CVE-2018-13379. This CVE is one of the most exploited CVEs since 2018. It is exploited by APT threat actors as well as cybercriminals. The exploitation of this CVE lead an unauthenticated user to get full access to FortiOS system file through SSL VPN via specially crafted HTTP resource requests. The exploit read /dev/cmdb/sslvpn_websession file, that contains login and passwords in (clear/text). An HTTP response status code = 200, means the file was successfully accessed. This vulnerability affects FortiOS 5.6.3 to 5.6.7 and FortiOS 6.0.0 to 6.0.4.

name: CVE-2020-0688 Microsoft Exchange Server Exploit
description: Detects the exploitation of CVE-2020-0688. The POC exploit a .NET serialization vulnerability in the Exchange Control Panel (ECP) web page. The vulnerability is due to Microsoft Exchange Server not randomizing the keys on a per-installation basis resulting in them using the same validationKey and decryptionKey values. With knowledge of these, values an attacker can craft a special viewstate to use an OS command to be executed by NT_AUTHORITY\SYSTEM using .NET deserialization. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker needs to leverage the credentials of an account it had already compromised to authenticate to OWA.

Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Microsoft Office Startup Add-In
description: Detects add-ins that load when Microsoft Word or Excel starts (.wll/.xll are simply .dll fit for Word or Excel). The rule requires File Creation logging to work, which can be done using Sysmon Event ID 11.

name: Logonui Wrong Parent
description: Logonui.exe is a file associated with the Logon user interface. The login user interface is an essential part of the Windows operating system. It doesn't only make it easy for the user to log in to the PC but also determines whether the user has logged in and logged out correctly and makes it easy to switch between users. This rule checks if the parent of this process is a legitimate one or not.

name: Microsoft Defender Antivirus Signatures Removed With MpCmdRun
description: Detects attempts to remove Windows Defender Signatures using MpCmdRun legitimate Windows Defender executable. No signatures mean Windows Defender will be less effective (or completely useless depending on the option used).

name: TUN/TAP Driver Installation
description: Detects the installation of the TUN or TAP driver service, this activity could be related to data exfiltration using tunneling techniques. The TUN/TAP Windows Adapter is a network driver that enables some VPN providers to facilitate a VPN connection to their server. TUN/TAP driver is only used by specific VPNs (e.g. OpenVPN, Wireguard), not by thoses based on IKE protocols (e.g. IPsec).

name: Credential Dump Tools Related Files
description: Detects processes or file names related to credential dumping tools and the dropped files they generate by default.

name: RDP Configuration File From Mail Process
description: Detects RDP configuration file being created or executed by a Mail-related process like Outlook. RDP configuration file will allow, when opened, an user to connect to the configured server easily. Attackers use this to trick victims in order to get a shared drive and potentially retrieve the data from that drive, but also drop a malicious file on the drive to establish persistence. Using RDP can also expose the victim's credential and clipboard data on some cases.
attack: collection - Data from Network Shared Drive (T1039)

name: Aspnet Compiler

name: Suspicious Windows ANONYMOUS LOGON Local Account Created

Created as a covering detection for attackers trying to created an ANONYMOUS LOGON account as it is an account named used in internal Windows events and frequently filtered by attackers.

Careful since the SwiftOnSecurity Sysmon's configuration needs to be changed to log for this specifically.

name: AutoIt3 Execution From Suspicious Folder
description: Detects AutoIt3 execution from an unusual/suspicious folder. Legitimate folders are "Program Files" and "AppData\\Local". AutoIt3.exe is a legitimate process used to execute AutoIt program files, which are used by legitimate software, custom scripts, but also malware. Finding AutoIt3 execution from unusual/suspicious folder can help detect malware activities, such as DarkGate execution. The detection rule can be tailored to your environment and your use of AutoIt3 by filtering out folder's execution of legitimate applications or scripts.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint

name: Suspicious PsExec Execution
description: Detects execution of PsExec, different from the Sysinternals one. This rule helps to filter out the noise if PsExec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different PsExec client other than Sysinternals one. The prerequisite is to log the Event ID 5145 (by setting "Audit Policy > Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share" to Success/Failure).

name: File Or Folder Permissions Modifications

The prerequisite is to log the Sysmon Event ID 7 (DLL image loaded by process).

Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]

description: Detects DLL image load activity as used by the threat group NOBELIUM with the FoggyWeb backdoor loader. The prerequisite is to log Loaded DLLs images, which can be done through the Sysmon Event ID 7 (DLL image loaded by process).

This event can be generated by attackers when searching for available windows servers in the network. This rule detects only users from external network.

name: Suspicious Hostname

Toease its task, the attacker requests tickets with weak encryption (such as RC4_HMAC_MD5). The rule therefore detects when an user is requesting 5 TGS for different users in 5 minutes.

Some drivers are used by several SysInternals tools, which should have been whitelisted in the filter condition. The driver named "DBUtilDrv2" has been removed as it caused too many false positives unfortunately. It can be added under "drv_name" if more coverage is wanted. This rule needs registry key monitoring (can be done with Sysmon Event IDs 12,13 and 14).

description: Dynamic-link libraries (DLLs) that are specified in the AppCertDLLs value in the Registry key can be abused to obtain persistence and privilege escalation by causing a malicious DLL to be loaded and run in the context of separate processes on the computer. Logging for Registry events is needed in the Sysmon configuration (events 12 and 13).
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Microsoft Defender Antivirus Restoration Abuse
description: The rule detects attempts to abuse Windows Defender file restoration tool. The Windows Defender process is allowed to write files in its own protected directory. This functionality can be used by a threat actor to overwrite Windows Defender files in order to prevent it from running correctly or use Windows Defender to execute a malicious DLL.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Mshta Command From A Scheduled Task
description: Detects when an attacker leverage the Microsoft Windows Scheduled task feature to run the mshta.exe process. This is a common usage of a living-off-the-land binary, frequently abused for malicous purposes and not common nowadays in IT administration.

name: Audit CVE Event
description: Detects events generated by Windows to indicate the exploitation of a known vulnerability.

name: Taskhost Wrong Parent
description: Detects if the Taskhost process was executed by a non-legitimate parent process. Taskhost is the process of the Windows Task Manager which lists the processes that are currently running on the computer system.

name: Winlogon wrong parent
description: Winlogon.exe is a process that performs the Windows login management function, handling user login and logout in Windows. You see this process in action whenever the operating system asks you for your username and password. It is also responsible for loading user profiles after login, this supports automated login (when relevant) and keyboard and mouse inactivity monitoring to decide when to invoke the screen saver. This rule analyse if the parent of this process is a legitimate one or not.

name: Remote Enumeration Of Lateral Movement Groups
description: Detects remote sessions that list the members of four local groups relevant to lateral movement. This behavior is common in Active Directory mapping tools such as SharpHound. Legitimate Active Directory auditing and monitoring tools (e.g. Varonis, Netwrix) will also be detected, and can by excluded by applying an alert filter on the SID of the service account (user.id).

name: Suspicious Outlook Child Process
description: Detects suspicious child processes of Microsoft Outlook. These child processes are often associated with spearphishing activity.

name: OneNote Embedded File
description: Detects creation or uses of OneNote embedded files with unusual extensions.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint

Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: WMIC Command To Determine The Antivirus
description: Detects WMIC command to determine the antivirus on a system, characteristic of the ZLoader malware (and possibly others)
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Svchost Wrong Parent
description: Detects if the svchost.exe process was executed by a non-legitimate parent process. Svchost (Service Host Process) is a generic host process name for services that run from dynamic-link libraries (DLLs).

name: Rare Logonui Child Found
description: Logonui.exe is a file associated with the Logon user interface. The login user interface is an essential part of the Windows operating system. It not only makes it easy for the user to log in to the PC but also determines whether the user has logged in and logged out correctly and makes it easy to switch between users. This process could create a child process but it is very rare and could be a signal of some process injection.

name: CMSTP Execution
description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Phosphorus (APT35) Exchange Discovery
description: According to the Miscosoft's report, the group Phosphorus (part of APT35) uses a specific PowerShell command to collect information about its the environment of compromised Microsoft Exchange servers. The command is the following: Get-Recipient | Select Name -ExpandProperty EmailAddresses -first 1 | Select SmtpAddress |  ft -hidetableheaders
intake-formats: Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]

name: Disable Security Events Logging Adding Reg Key MiniNt
description: Detects the addition of a key 'MiniNt' to the registry. Upon a reboot, Windows Event Log service will stopped write events.  Prerequisites: Logging for Registry events for this specific registry key is needed in the Sysmon configuration (events 12, 13 and 14).

name: Network Share Discovery
description: Adversaries may look for folders and drives shared on remote systems as a means of identifying sources of information to gather as a precursor for Collection and to identify potential systems of interest for Lateral Movement. Networks often contain shared network drives and folders that enable users to access file directories on various systems across a network. File sharing over a Windows network occurs over the SMB protocol. This technique is frequently leveraged by threat actors such as APT32, APT41, Wizard Spider. But also, through the use of some malware such as Cobalt Strike, Empire, PlugX and Ramsay.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Wmic Suspicious Commands
description: Detects suspicious commands used by the process wmic to get informations on the system.

name: APT29 Fake Google Update Service Install
description: This method detects malicious services mentioned in APT29 report by FireEye. The legitimate path for the Google update service is C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Update\GoogleUpdate.exe so the service names and executable locations used by APT29 are specific enough to be detected in log files.

name: Mimikatz LSASS Memory Access
description: Detection of in-memory Mimikatz by focusing on processes opening the Local Security Authority (Lsass.exe) process and reading the memory contents of it. This probably means that Mimikatz has been executed on the host, meaning the attacker already has high privileges and is looking to dump credentials, most likely for lateral movement or privilege escalation purposes. The rule requires Sysmon EventID 10 to work as it is based on the GrantedAccess mask.

The same result can be obtained by using the Get-Credential function but detecting it will trigger a lot of FP.

name: SysKey Registry Keys Access

The SysKey allows to decrypt Security Account Mannager (SAM) database entries (from registry or hive) and get NTLM, and sometimes LM hashes of local accounts passwords. Adversaries can calculate the Syskey by using RegOpenKeyEx/RegQueryInfoKey API calls to query the appropriate class info and values from the HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\JD, HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\Skew1, HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\GBG, and HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\Data keys.

name: Domain Group And Permission Enumeration

Commands such as net group /domain of the Net utility can list domain-level groups The knowledge of domain-level permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group. Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as domain administrators. Wizard Spider, FIN6, and other groups used net in their campaigns.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Active Directory Database Dump Via Ntdsutil
description: Detects the dump of ntdis.dit database by using the utility ntdsutil.exe. NTDS.dit database stores Active Directory data, including passwords hashes for all users in the domain.

name: CertOC Loading Dll
description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to loads the target DLL file.

Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Venom Multi-hop Proxy agent detection
description: Detects Venom Multi-hop Proxy agent.

Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Smss Wrong Parent
description: Detects if the Smss process was executed by a non-legitimate parent process. Session Manager Subsystem (smss) process is a component of the Microsoft Windows NT family of operating systems.

name: Registry Key Used By Some Old Agent Tesla Samples
description: Detects potential use of the RUN registry key to execute some Agent Tesla samples at boot. Prerequisites are to log for Registry events in the Sysmon configuration (events 12 and 13).
attack: privilege-escalation - Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder (T1547.001)

name: Creation or Modification of a GPO Scheduled Task
description: Detects lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, often used to deploy ransomware at scale. This rule is based on the EventID 5145 which is specific to Windows Servers. The advanced audit policy setting Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share must be configured for Success/Failure.

name: Mshta JavaScript Execution
description: Identifies suspicious mshta.exe commands that execute JavaScript supplied as a command line argument.

name: Microsoft Exchange PowerShell Snap-Ins To Export Exchange Mailbox Data

Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: User Couldn't Call A Privileged Service LsaRegisterLogonProcess
description: The LsaRegisterLogonProcess function verifies that the application making the function call is a logon process by checking that it has the SeTcbPrivilege privilege set. Possible Rubeus tries to get a handle to LSA. This rule requires to log the Event ID 4673, which can be done by updating the Audit Policy.

name: Remote Privileged Group Enumeration
description: Detects remote listing of local privileged group. Potential false positives, which should justify alert filters, are service accounts and administrators doing maintenance.

name: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed
description: Detects changes to RDP terminal service sensitive settings. Logging for registry events is needed in the Sysmon configuration (events 12 and 13).

name: KeePass Config XML In Command-Line
description: Detects a command-line interaction with the KeePass Config XML file. It could be used to retrieve informations or to be abused for persistence.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Suspicious Control Process
description: Detects suspicious execution of control.exe process when used to execute a DLL file.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Abusing Azure Browser SSO
description: Detects abusing Azure Browser SSO by requesting OAuth 2.0 refresh tokens for an Azure-AD-authenticated Windows user (i.e. the machine is joined to Azure AD and a user logs in with their Azure AD account) wanting to perform SSO authentication in the browser. An attacker can use this to authenticate to Azure AD in a browser as that user. This technique leverages the COM object (CoCreateInstance), which loads the DLL "C:\Windows\System32\MicrosoftAccountTokenProvider.dll", to get an authentication token. Monitoring the load of this DLL can detect an attacker abusing this technique. More details on this technique are available in the article in the source section. The prerequisite is to log for Loaded DLLs, it can be done using the Sysmon Event ID 7 (DLL image loaded by process).

name: Suspicious LDAP-Attributes Used
description: Detects the usage of particular AttributeLDAPDisplayNames, which are known for data exchange via LDAP by the tool LDAPFragger and are additionally not commonly used in companies. Careful as the 5136 is only on domain controllers and needs to be activated through the Group Policy.

name: Antivirus Relevant File Paths Alerts
description: Detects an Antivirus alert in a highly relevant file path or with a relevant file name. This is only based on Windows Defender events.

name: Privileged AD Builtin Group Modified
description: Detects changes to privileged AD builtin groups in Active Directory that could indicate malicious or unexpected administrative activity. This detection rule detects changes on specific groups that are Administrators (S-1-5-*-500), Domain Admins (S-1-5-*-512), Enterprise Admins (S-1-5-*-519), Schema Admins (S-1-5-*-518), Account Operators (S-1-5-32-548) and Backup Operators (S-1-5-32-551).
attack: privilege-escalation - Domain or Tenant Policy Modification (T1484)

name: Data Compressed With Rar

Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: Shadow Copies

name: Potential RDP Connection To Non-Domain Host

Event ID 8001 corresponds to outgoing NTLM authentication traffic and TermSrv stands for RDP Terminal Services Server. Check if the contacted host is legitimate. To use this detection rule, enable logging of outbound NTLM authentications on all domain controllers, using the following Group Policy (GPO) - Computer Configuration > Policies > Windows Settings > Security Settings > Local Policies > Security Options > Network security: Restrict NTLM: Outgoing NTLM traffic to remote servers -> Define this policy setting: Audit all.

name: Disable Workstation Lock

Its creation is suspicious and the value set to "1" means an activation. It has been used by FatalRAT, but other attacker/malware could probably use it. This rule needs Windows Registry changes (add,modification,deletion) logging which can be done through Sysmon Event IDs 12,13,14.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Vision One Workbench Alerts [BETA]

name: Exploited CVE-2020-10189 Zoho ManageEngine

name: CVE-2021-34527 PrintNightmare Suspicious Actions From Spoolsv
description: Detects suspicious image loads and file creations from the spoolsv process which could be a sign of an attacker trying to exploit the PrintNightmare vulnerability, CVE-2021-34527. A remote code execution vulnerability exists when the Windows Print Spooler service improperly performs privileged file operations. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could run arbitrary code with SYSTEM privileges. This works as well as a Local Privilege escalation vulnerability. To fully work the rule requires to log for Loaded DLLs and File Creations, which can be done respectively using the Sysmon's event IDs 7 and 11.
intake-formats: Trend Micro Apex One / Vision One endpoint
Trend Micro Cloud One / Deep Security

name: SSH Port Binding
description: When a user uses SSH tunneling in Linux, the sshd process binds sockets to communicate with the client machine via a ssh tunnel. With SSH tunneling, the SSH server can be used as a getaway to access internal systems. The traffic will seem to be coming from the SSH server whereas it only acts as a relay for an attacker. By using this technique, an attacker can successfully bypass external firewall rules. This rule is the most basic one (compared to the other one - SSH Tunnel), however it can detect the -D option in the ssh command if the machine is the client. This rule will detect the port binding (port 6010) when X11 forwarding is used. It will detect -R (server side), -D (client side) -X (server side), -Y (server side) and -L (client side) port binding.

name: Many Downloads From Several Binaries

name: SSH Tunnel Traffic
description: When a user creates and uses a SSH tunnel in Linux, the sshd process opens sockets to communicate with other machines or ports. With SSH tunneling, the SSH server can be used as a getaway to access internal systems. The traffic will seem to be coming from the SSH server whereas it only acts as a relay for an attacker. By using this technique, an attacker can successfully bypass external firewall rules and gain foothold to your network, allowing him to scan,hunt and attack your internal systems. This rule includes a filter on port 22, this filter is created to avoid false positive when a user is connecting via ssh. If you do not use port 22 for your machines, please create an alert filter.

name: Process Anti Debug Checking
description: Entries in /proc/self/status are used by malware to checks if current process is being debug. The prerequisites are to enable monitoring of the openat, openat2, open and open_by_handle_at syscalls using Auditbeat.

name: Disabled Service
description: Service disabling can be abused by attacker to deny security mecanisms (eg: firewall, EDR, ect) and it is also often used by cryptominer to exploit as much RAM & CPU as possible on infected host. The prerequisites are to enable monitoring of the truncate, rename and unlink syscalls using Auditbeat.

name: Kernel Module Alteration

The prerequisites are to enable monitoring of the finit_module, init_module, delete_module syscalls using Auditbeat.
